channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: St Julian's Road, 5th November
item.description:
Leaves all along pavement and kerb.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Julians Road, London

item.title: Left barriers blocking pavement, 5th November
item.description:
A tree stump was removed about a month ago and barriers have been left since. They keep getting moved around and are not even protecting the hole in the pavement any more, but are blocking the pavement and forcing people to walk on the street.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Adolphus Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped, 5th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Greenhithe Close, Avery Hill, London

item.title: Overflowing leaves, 5th November

item.title: Excess leaves from approx 60ft tall trees in guttera and on pavements and will cause dangerous walkways with rain, 5th November
item.description:
Crown lane is never cleared properly as truck only goes round the parked cars no sucker or blower has been used. It is one of the most neglected roads round here when street cleaners are about as they seem to pick and choose which part of the road they will clean. Surely there is a printed clearing schedule forecast, Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Lane, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flag attached, 5th November
item.description:
Some fachist attached a flag on a street light. It is obviously put there as a sign of rejection for the local immigrants. This should be removed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Wood, London

item.title: Heavy metal canister dumped by tree, 5th November
item.description:
Opposite 155 Graham Road at the base of a tree someone has dumped a heavy metal canister (laughing gas?), as we see fairly often in our neighbourhood - I hope this will be collected for recycling, please; thanks
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Graham Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Regrowth at base of trees causing poor visibility hen crossing his fast flowing road, 5th November
item.description:
We reported this at the end of September Brom Council responded ref 565448 acknowledging information Nothing has been done I am 72 my husband 75 years very dangerous for us and all pedestrians crossing from one side to the other. I am keeping a record of these messages.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Lane, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Not fixed, 5th November
item.description:
I don't know why my report has been changed to 'fixed' by the council. The road is filthy and only keeps getting worse. It hasn't had a visit from the council.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ceres Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement obstructed, 5th November
item.description:
Ceres Road is absolutely filthy with rubbish and leaves everywhere. Why is the street getting ignored? The pavements are blocked by the amount of rubbish on it. The whole road is filthy and in desperate need of a clean and sweep. Please can someone from the council come

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ceres Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
